Reviews.Title: “Poor Show!”
Reviews.Author: K M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusted with this place to be honest, the room was tiny and didnt have a view unless you call a brick wall with some grafitti nice to look at! The price was more than some 4 star places charge although you may have to stay near the airport but also this is at the very bottom of Signal so a good twenty to thirty minute walk from the train station. One good thing was the bathroom but not even a bar of soap was found upoon arrival and having had high hopes for this establishment I was left very underwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend, the location was great. Quite close to everything you needed. The way the hotel rooms are set out is strange. We had the choice of 2 rooms. One room up 5 flights of stairs which the stairs were very narrow, or a room on the ground floor but had no window. I didn't want to keep walking up the stairs so chose the ground floor room. It did bother me thy we had no window as it was a dark room. The receptionist mo was really friendly. Helped us with where was best to go etc. there is a nightclub right next door so on the Saturday night we didn't get much sleep. But the room was clean, the television had some English channels including MTV. It was quite cheap considering what prices we were looking at for similar rooms for 2 nights. But I think I will paying a little bit extra next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: Lauren D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is expensive and most hotel rooms are small. That being said, this hotel is better than some I've stayed at previously, and was a bargain in comparison. The staff was helpful and the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “only the location was good”
Reviews.Author: Sara V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to other people... The location is fabulous, but that's it. The breakfast is very small, the room we had was without window, next to the disco, next to kitchen/laundryroom...

Reviews.Title: “Friday night in Amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent value for money and a great location. It was close to the tram stop, easy to find and close to the sights and nightlife in Rembrandtplein! We had a very nice view of the canal outside, The room was a bit too warm on arrival but nice when we came in from the cold! The staff were really friendly and helped us with our bags on the very steep stairs!!! Missed breakfast so can't comment on this! We would recommend this to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Party life or Sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Damien880
Reviews.Content: The triple room was small. The toilet had no window so not to nice after a night on the town. But if you like to travel around Amsterdam its not central location but its 5 minutes from the start of all the main shops and streets. Staff were nice and fresh towels were there every morning. If you want the party life for the weekend then the hotel is not to be stayed in but if you want to travel and sight see in Amsterdam then its a Yes from me as it gives access to a few streets leading to different parts of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Danny L
Reviews.Content: Tried to check out from 8.45 PM the evening before I had to leave because of an early meeting. Unfortunately it proved impossible to get a hold of any staff before 8am the next day (an hour after I should have checked out). I tried calling the after hour phone they had listed on their door for such circumstances, but no answer even though I called about 5 times. When I finally got check out it turned out that they couldn't accept any creditcards even though there card machines and logos from the major credit card companies on the reception desk. That meant that I had to go out and locate an ATM. When I returned with the cash I found out that they weren't able to provide me with a receipt, I had to wait to 10 o'clock to get that, since I already ran late they promised to email me the receipt at 10am (not sure why 10am was the receipt time), but of course, I have not received any receipt. If it wasn't for the fact that they had my passport locked up I would have left right away leaving the issue of an un-payed bill to the incompetent staff. Besides that I have had construction work right outside my window that they didn't inform about, the shower was "fixed" with duct tape, the wi-fi works maxium 15 minutes before it dies out (tried to post this while in my room, but internet didn't work for 40 minutes) remote control doesn't work and the only place for my carry on bag was on the floor, next to the bed. The room in general is dirty and worn down. Like others have mentioned, the hotel has a great location, but that doesn't justify the prize for this hotel which is not a hotel, it's dirty hostel that charges 4 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: irkeninvader
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night earlier this year as part of a mini cruise to Amsterdam. It was in a pretty good location as we could get to everything easily, but we didn't enjoy the stay at the hotel. We booked the budget room so we weren't expecting anything amazing but it failed to meet even our low expectations. The room was right at the top of the hotel, which was okay but it was difficult to get our suitcase up the very narrow stairs (not necessarily the hotels fault but they also didn't offer any help). The room had a private bathroom (not ensuite) but this was right next to another room, and we didn't know if they would also be using it. The room didn't look too dirty at first glance but it felt dirty, and we ended up staying out as long as possible to avoid being stuck in there - not somewhere we felt we could chill out after walking around all day. I wouldn't mind the tiny room and the narrow stairs if I felt that my Â£80 (!) for a budget room had been well spent. But there's no way I would have spent so much on the room if I'd known what I was getting - I would have paid the extra to stay somewhere nicer. I know Amsterdam is expensive but I still want some sort of value for my money!

Reviews.Title: “okay for a budget hotel for young people - doesn't worth more than 60 â‚¬/night”
Reviews.Author: ghost_object
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night. First, do not make any reservations through their own website, it's much more expensive (about 120 â‚¬ /night !!). When you book this hotel, do so, if you are traveling for instance with friends, intend to party, avoid taxi costs at night when back from clubs or bars and be a lot outside and not spend time in the room. The staff is very friendly, if I dare say, maybe too friendly and flexible... I had booked a Twin room for one night under my name in order to stay with a girlfriend. I arrived at around 3 pm. At the desk, the kind receptionist said to me, that my friend is already in my room with a man and that I could just go up there.... Yes, I knew my friend had arrived one night before and had booked a room for the previous night. And I understand the idea to let us stay in the same room the 2 consecutive nights, so that my friend wouldn't have to move her stuff around. But still I found the situation very bizarre and unprofessional. Why was that previous guest still in the room at 3 - 4 pm when he's check out was at 11 or 12 am? I asked the receptionist to go herself inform that guest of my arrival as I didn't know the man at all. I felt uncomfortable and too old or psycho-rigid for that kind of situation and attitude. I had to wait for the man to leave. My bed was made later in the evening. The rooms are really tiny, so is the window and the bathroom (you can hear everything from the bathroom). The room was already in use when I arrived so I can't say about the cleanliness, but it seemed better than I expected. There was no breakfast service. On the plus side, there was an empty fridge in the room, where you could store your own drinks and food, and there's a supermarket just in the corner of the street. The room is really basic but okay for a budget hotel. There's no elevator and the stairs are kind of uneven and exiguous. Might be difficult if traveling with a very large suitcase... Not suitable for seniors. Seems like more a hotel intended for young partying people. So, if you're not in a happy, festive, flexible, careless mood stay away from this hotel. The location is fantastic. The receptionist was very kind, there really was something warm and friendly about the staff . Yet, it was bizarre when I left I just had to leave the key through a door, there wasn't anyone at all at the reception. So I would say, it's a good choice if you pay no more than 60 - 65 â‚¬ per night double, twin or single room. It's not worth more than that. The 120 â‚¬ asked on their own website is really absolutely over priced. One can get much much better places for that kind of money. But, yes, I could stay again in this hotel if it's the cheapest choice and if I intend just to have fun during summer or spring with friends... Not suitable for a romantic gateway.

Reviews.Title: “what a joke”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastghost
Reviews.Content: this was an awful experience. the room was approximately 12' x 12'. the twin beds had to be pushed together to fit.the mattress was equivalent to a futon. there was a closet but only one door would open in the space available. there was no room for a bureau so our bags remained unpacked and shoved under the bed. the amenities were advertised as a tv ( worked 2 of 5 days),a mini fridge that didn't work at all and a coffee machine without coffee or a carafe to make it in. as a highlight the bathroom was servicable and basically clean. the room was only serviced/cleaned twice in our 5 night stay. the front desk was only open between the hours of 10 and 8 and there wasn't a phone or much help to be found. this was advertised as a 2 star hotel so we didn't have unrealistic expectations but this is more a youth hostel with hotel prices. i was jet lagged when i finally got to my room but having to pay in full up front should have set off my alarms. if i hadn't paid upfront i wouldn't have stayed one night. my advice is if you're considering staying at this 'hotel', DON'T.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: jiggylilly
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to lay your head for the night in amsterdam, you can't go wrong here. Brilliant location to set out and see the sites. I stayed here with friends and we found the staff on arrival helpful and friendly, the stairs up to the bedrooms are brilliantly steep, we felt privallaged to be staying in a proper waterfront hotel that hadn't been too modernised so had orginal features. The room was cosy and warm, the furniture was pretty basic, but at this price it's very good value for money in expensive amsterdam! If they refurbish then i guess the prices would go up. As I said we just wanted a place to lay our heads and this was perfect, the bedding was clean and the room quiet and peaceful. Nice hot showers in the morning and fresh towels everyday. Breakfast was continental and you could eat as much as you liked. This place really did feel like a proper slice out of amsterdam, I felt like i was experiencing the real amsterdam far more by staying here than one of the big chain hotels, and so forgave it for all it's quirks and saw them as perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AliCat100
Reviews.Content: I was really concerned about staying at this place having read all the reviews on here! But I have to say, weighing everything up it was good value and I would stay here again. Hotels are expensive in Amsterdam so I think for the Waterfront you are really paying for the location. It is in a fantastic central location which makes seeing all the main sights incredibly easy. The Riksjmuseum, Anne Frank's house, Dam square, red light district, centre of town etc are all within 10 mins walking (15 if you are a slower walker). Our room itself was quite small, but the bed was very comfy, a warm duvet and the radiator was always on and temperature could be adjusted. The bathroom was small (with a shower and toilet) but clean. We had fresh towels each day which was good. My main complaint was when I had a shower one morning and I heard the people in the room next door using their bathroom and so the water would just trickle out. Although this was at about 10am which is when breakfast finishes, so I'd advise shower a bit earlier and you'll be fine (as I did the other 2 mornings at around 9am). Breakfast was served 8.30-10am and although it was modest it was nice and set us up for the day. It included bread/toast, butter, jam, ham, salami, cheese and on some days boiled eggs also. The free Wifi and range of free maps and brochures at reception was also handy. The staff were a mixed bag really, friendly girl on the day we checked in but grumpy guy at breakfast! He wasn't rude, just wasn't forthcoming or friendly. I hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: FilumBarbs
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit to this hotel and this time we had a room on the top floor with a tremendous view over the Singel Canal. Yes, the stairs are very steep and there are a lot of them to the top floor but this is what it is like in any value hotel in Amsterdam. Anyway, you only have to carry your luggage up one time. Ok, so maybe some of the fixtures and fittings have seen better days but the bedding is spotlessly clean and the beds extremely comfortable. If you want to be based in this great area of Amsterdam and don't want to pay a fortune for one of the big chain hotels, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel !”
Reviews.Author: trollydollyliverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with 2 friends, for my 21st. Location was good apart from the fact we got lost everynight lol Rooms where clean, staff where friendly. The only thing that was a bit of a problem was we where on the top floor and the stairs where so steep but this is not the hotels fault it is like this all over amsterdam !!! would stay at this hotel again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean 2* hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dasuberdog
Reviews.Content: I was quite concerned after reading some of the poor reviews on TA prior to my visit, but this hotel was absolutely fine! We ended up arriving later than planned due to travel complications, but the staff kept the reception open for us and explained how we could get the tram from Centraal Station to the hotel (it's about four short stops from right outside the station). They were pretty gracious about the whole situation, considering that someone was working late to let us in. Once we'd scaled the incredibly steep stairs, we found we'd got a reasonably sized triple room, there wasn't much room around the beds as you would expect from a 2*, but we had a table, chairs, tea/coffee facilities and an en-suite bathroom. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean and in working order. All the furniture/fixtures/fittings were reasonably modern, although not totally brand new. We stayed in one of the front rooms, which had a pleasant view onto the canal. The location is brilliant - far enough away from the horrible tourist trap bars and coffee shops, but there's still decent nightlife to be had in the area, and there were some good bars, restaurants and coffee shops nearby. It's a really nice walk along the canal to the central area, or there are trams available at the corner of the block the Waterfront is on. Walking around near the hotel felt safe even late at night, the area is full of lots of local people going about their business, rather than drunk tourists and prostitutes. The breakfast was fine - simple continental breakfast, toast, jam, meat, cheese etc. - and served in their small breakfast room by friendly multilingual staff. There's free wi-fi available, it worked a treat and saved me expensive data roaming charges! The Waterfront is absolutely perfect if you are looking for a cheap, clean, friendly base for your Amsterdam adventures - we were a small group of late-twenties city break tourists, not looking to rough it in a hostel or luxuriate in a 5* - this place definitely fit the bill as somewhere in between!

Reviews.Title: “hell-hole of a hotel - dont ever stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aditmisha
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel ever - strong recommendation not to stay here. Weâ€™ve travelled a lot in Europe lately and booked hotels on Expedia a number of times but this was an absolute nightmare of a place. In fact we moved out of the hotel and stayed in another place. The hotel is absolutely filthy - the room and bathroom was in a deplorable condition, carpets not cleaned, stains on the wall and curtains. Very poor hygiene standards â€“ definitely not fit for human habitation! The room was very small in size - essentially only room for the beds and no place even to keep your luggage. You have to walk sideways to get anywhere in the room. There was no hot water in the tiny shower. The hotel manager is extremely rude and nasty. The woman has no idea on how to run a hotel. She is just ripping people off and is extremely unhelpful. Donâ€™t trust the photographs as they are extremely misleading - our room was nothing like the picture (and we even saw some other rooms while walking to ours) BOTTOM LINE â€“ DONâ€™T STAY IN THIS HOTEL FOR SURE.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! The worst hotel ever !!!”
Reviews.Author: Oneredkat
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in and I have been all over the world. It stinks like pee pee, the rooms are small, everything is broken in the room, we were eaten alive by mosquitos at night, the breakfast was horrible! The stairs to the rooms are straight up - like the ladder on a ship and you have to drag your bags up two flights. The only good thing is the location. The staff member was nice but she was from Portugal and couldn't help us with any information or directions. Let this be a warning - I want to spare you the pain we suffered!

Reviews.Title: “one room was given to others before we arrived”
Reviews.Author: Asiabeachbums
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms for 3 adults via www.hotels.nl for 2 nights during the weekend march 27-29. One of the conditions of the reservation is to telephone the hotel if you will check-in after 16.00 hrs on day of arrival. This we did this on 2 occasions: the day before and the morning of arrival. When we arrived we were informed that one of the 2 rooms had been given to another party due to mistakes made by an incompetent employee. On a busy weekend in Amsterdam with no hotel rooms available, 3 of us had to cram into a 2 room appartment which was poorly serviced, although the hotel staff was helpful Even though the hotel was way overbooked there was a "vacancies" sign in the window. Curious don't you think?

Reviews.Title: “run away this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vixtor
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 8 days, I had an horrible tiny room on the courtyard, you have to know that it is just beside a night club, bring your ear-plugs if you want to try to sleep before 4 am on week-end .. Also one lamp was not working, the TV either, the bath towel were not changed for the 8 days. This is just a bed and what we can see as a "breakfeast"

Reviews.Title: “Approach with caution - expensive and very dirty”
Reviews.Author: macgran
Reviews.Content: The 'friendly staff' were clearly not around that day. After a 20min wait in reception (no bell) a girl drifted in but didn't appear to have a clue. The owner then showed up and immediately charged an extra 4% on the booking although it was booked and subsequently paid for with a debit not credit card. The hotel is filthy - we had the canal side attic room which is VERY high up (no lift) and, other than in the centre part of the room, the carpet had clearly not been vacuumed for years. Underneath the radiators was just disgusting. The room and bed smelled of smoke and, on the window ledge, there were countless cigarette butts. The bathroom was also horrible - mould on the ceiling, nasty blacked grout between the tiles and a hole in the door for the vent. Water pressure in the shower was non-existent and the loo seat was all chipped and horrid. This is only a 2 star hotel so perhaps I shouldn't be too mean but it cost 165 Euros which I think for the dirty state it was in, was very expensive. The benefit of the hotel is that it is in a good location - all the city is easily accessible (although as Amsterdam is small, that is probably true of most places) - the canal side rooms over look the canal but also a busy road AND, there is a nightclub next door which means that if you have trouble sleeping - don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here! You Will Regret It!”
Reviews.Author: tom106
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend booked a stay at this hotel using the website easytobook.nl. Upon arrival we were told that they had no record of our reservation and we would have to upgrade to a more expensive canalside room. My girlfriend explained that the booking error was not our problem but we were told they were fully booked and didnt have any other rooms. As it was the bank holiday we did not feel that we would be able to find a room elsewhere so we had no choice but to get ripped off by him. Also one morning when we were having breakfast, there was a huge argument going on between the owner and one of the guests who were leaving that day which involved lots of shouting about them getting ripped off, to which the owner responded very aggressively. The guest stormed out and his wife followed him in floods of tears. Having read other reviews of this hotel, we found many other people were also tricked into having the most expensive room. We believe the owner of this hotel to be extremely untrustworthy Avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED ***STAY AWAY OR YOU WILL BE ROBBED BLIND***”
Reviews.Author: MartialAnt
Reviews.Content: I cant beleive what i have just read. I wasnt being overly paranoid at all. I stayed in The Waterfront hotel in Amsterdam. Was charged 225 Euro's for a double room. Since reading there website that room should have only cost 135 Euro's. Only paid it because we had spent 3 hours looking for somewhere to stay. The room was 3m x 3m and not en-suite (even though the website says all rooms are). To use the bathroom you had to go into the corridor. It wasnt even a double bed, it was two single beds of not same height pushed together. Within an hour the worker or owner (not sure which) around 40 years old looked a bit like mr easyjet with expensive glasses tried to break into our room. Just by chance i was opening my door which made him run which looked odd. He couldnt be running from anything else. Then an other hour later he was at my door again listening to see if we were in. He was there for over ten minutes. I was watching him through my spy hole. I coughed loudly and he legged it again. How desperate was he!!! This made us very paranoid which had me using the spy hole everytime i heard a noise. He had also been into the next guests room on our floor. It was top of the building, two guest rooms and a toilet. There was no other reason for him to be there. If i had complained about this at the time, i felt i would have been kicked out of the hotel and back to square one and certainly no refund. Steer clear of this hotel. If your not cleaned out by the price of a room, you most certainly will be by someone that works there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: derfina
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the hotel Waterfront in April 2007...The staff was friendly and helpful before and during our stay, our room was beautiful-we actually stayed in the room they show on the website with the tub bathroom....Lovely bay window with canal view, and the weather was perfect for opening the windows and watching the boats go by in the canal...A guy even pulled up in a boat playing a saxaphone-I guess he was playing at the restaurant next door that evening, but the little impromptu concert was lovely. There is an Albert Heijn grocery store on the corner (with a webcam overlooking the corner in case you want to wave hi to friends back home), a beergarden/restaurant on the opposite corner, and the tram stop is right around the corner...Breakfast was plentiful and beautifully presented for such a small place-only ten rooms....We have stayed in more expensive hotels in Amsterdam, but have agreed that from now on, the Waterfront will be home base for us!

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront Hotel is Great.”
Reviews.Author: jugadorone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the waterfront hotel and it was great. we had read bad reviews about it , but it is now under new ownership/ management and you could'nt ask for better. The staff was excellent, the little breakfast was nice . You need to pay the extra for the canal view, it makes all the difference in the world. its in a great location, a supermarket is around the corner as is a tram stop, and a nice place to sit outside and drink a few beers and watch the world go by is across the canal. On the weekends the bar next door is a little noisy , but we didnt have a problem with it. If you go to amsterdam to have fun like we do, a little music next door wont stop you from sleeping, it didnt us. If that kind of stuff bothers you, ,, go to Paris. We will definatly stay here again when we go back to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: TravelproScotland
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the hotel for a weekend break. We were welcomed quite enthusiastically by the owner and asked for our credit card on arrival. I noticed that he wanted to charge us for a higher amount than agreed (ie credit card surcharge) and agreed to pay cash the following morning. That was lucky. When we got to our room in the attik, after climbing stairs that were as steep as ladders, it was just terrible. The room was dirty, smelled of smoke, the curtain rail was hanging off, ther was a hole in the back of the wardrobe, it was so tiny there was nowhere to put the little lugguage we had, the kettle was not usable because it was so dirty, ... Further we had booked ensuite facilities. The bathroom had to be accessed with a key from the hallway and it was clearly used by other people as well. The towels were in the shared bathroom and had definitely been used. We returned to the reception but is was all locked up. We decided to stay for the night. In the morning we explained that this was not the room we had booked and unless we could be moved we would leave. The owner was very agressive and started an argument in view of all his other guests. We paid E 100 - a very generous amount for what we had - and left. I would not recommend this hovel to anyone. It was the worst place I had ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: Seats42
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights there at the end of June. In all of our travels in Europe, this hotel would rank at the bottom of our list. Bathroom trash was not emptied the entire time we were there. We wondered if there was any cleaning of the room at all. There were room darkening curtains on only one of the two windows. We had a room that faced the canal. It was very noisy. So if you are a light sleeper, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review”
Reviews.Author: paris4awhile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay but it has problems and it seems hard to justify the price. Comfortable beds, small rooms, but furnished decently. Nice breakfast but not served until 9 am. Not exactly great timing for go-getter tourists who want to be first in line at museums. That said, we found that nothing else opened that early in Amsterdam anyway (but perhaps that is the very best reason to serve an earlier breakfast). The stairs are atrocious and can only be compared to a tiny ladder that goes straight up. Very difficult to navigate with even small-medium sized luggage. The big negative is bright shining lights outside window. On street front rooms there are three windows, only two of which have curtains. The light shining into the room is extremely bright, to the point where it made sleep difficult. The first person we asked about it did nothing. The second was extremely helpful and did all that he could. Still, the hotel needs curtains on all its windows. Beautiful location, right next to main tram lines making it easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: RoseandRoy
Reviews.Content: this hotel definitely gets mixed reviews.The room was tiny,even for europe,but the bed was comfortable. The location was great during the day because it was right along the canal with great access to cafes, shops and trolleys. It was also back to back with a dance club that plays loud music till 4 in the morning,so unless you're a night person, you won't be getting much sleep. The breakfast was good and plentiful and the owners friendly and helpful, except for the night when we woke up at 1 a.m. to hear them using their key and stepping into our room! When we said a loud, HEY! they said oh, sorry, and left, but what were they doing there? The worst part was that the stairs to the upstairs rooms are so narrow that it is scary to take a suitcase up or down. Almost like a ladder.

Reviews.Title: “the owner is a thief!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay ever in Amsterdam. We usually stay at Hotel Wiechmann, which is wonderfull!. Mr.Ham, owner of the Waterfront told us that as he had plumbing problems the promised room was no longer available. He then put us in a dingy little room way up in the attic with no view what so ever, terrible. And now I am reading some other reports on this sham of a hotel where other guests were frauded out of their money, just like we were. My advise: DO NOT GO NEAR THE PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Worst 'hotel' in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE!!! We went with a group of friends and booked three rooms in total. TWO OF THEM WERE 'VISITED' We lost an Ipod, two digital camera, an Iriver and â‚¬250. NO DOOR BROKEN!!!!! NO EXCUSE FROM THE MANAGER. THIS PLACE IS COMPLETELY UNSAFE AND UNPROFESSIONAL. AVOID AT ALL COST!!!!!!!!!!!!!! On top of this, I only realised the items were missing when I arrived at Heathrow, therefore too late for a police deposition, I called the police, they told me to call the embassy, and vice versa....

Reviews.Title: “Dream Team Dam Experience”
Reviews.Author: kspargo
Reviews.Content: Shamone! We stayed at the Waterfront as a group of 3 girls. When we arrived we were greeted by Mr Van der Ham and given a guide to the city. Our room and en-suite bathroom were very clean and we had clean towels and maid service every day. Canal view great. Location great, within walking distance to all main attractions and nightlife, or you can catch a tram just up from hotel. Breakfast delicious with a good selection. Excellent for a 2* accomodation, we would definately return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a few beautiful days”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam for a few days early April and had booked this hotel over the Internet using their website ------ and we liked it very much. Helpful and friendly services and the rooms were very nice. We had a room with canal view and especially in the evening we had a marvellous view. The hotel is immediately in the centre and you can walk to all museums etc. For information you can ask the owner and his staff. They are very helpful in planning your day. We can recommend this hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a homestay”
Reviews.Author: frozensky
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little place with very steep stairs. I think it can go up to 4th or 5th floor. They can help you carry up your luggage. I got a 75 Euro quote through Rentalo for low season (January), but when I got there, they said 80 Euro, which I agreed to because he said he'll put me in a river-view room starting the second night (I stayed a total of 4 nights). The first night was spent in a tiny room, which I would not even pay 70 Euro for. Luckily, I got my river-view room starting the second night, but it was the one on top floor (sort of like the attic), so the room was a lot smaller than the river-view rooms in the lower floors and the climb up was quite tiring after a day of walking. The location of this hotel is great though since you can pretty much walk everywhere. Breakfast was okay. You can use their internet if you ask. Overall, it's a very warm place with very nice people. I'm sure the bigger rooms with river-views on the lower floors are very nice to stay in, but since they're facing the river and the streets, it gets a bit noisy toward dawn if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Do not stay here!!! (I urge you to read this review...)”
Reviews.Author: ATay71
Reviews.Content: I love to travel and have stayed in countless hotels, motels, hostels, and such the world over. Staying at the Hotel Waterfront was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I have much to say about the hotel, so I'll try to be concise... here are some major bad points followed by a stroy that everyone should read. (A) NOISY. The hotel is located directly next to a discotechque. The noise of the disco is bad, but the patrons leaving the place at 4AM, screaming down the echoing canal is beyond tolerable. Street noise is also very bad as the old windows. (B) NEEDS REPAIR. This place is by no means a filthy place, but my room was a bit run-down. Cigarette burns in the drapes and carpeting. The shower went from freezing to scalding and back in a matter of seconds. The photos of their rooms on their website are not a fair representation of what your room will actually look like. They're touched up and dressed up. (C) RUDE & UNTRUSTWORTHY MANAGER/OWNER. We decided to check out and find other accomodations based on our first night's stay. We agreed to pay the one night penalty just to be done with this awful place. Unfortunately, my troubles with this hotel and it's owner did not end for several months after my check-out. When you check in, they make an imprint of your credit card and urge you to pay in cash at check-out, however they make you sign a credit card slip that states your full amount. When we checked out after the first night, we agreed to pay for two nights. When we returned home we found our credit card had been charged for the full eight nights. We called the owner and he said he would credit our account. A month later, nothing had been credited to my account so I filed a complaint with MasterCard. In response, I was harrassed with phone calls from the owner in the middle of the night, made to my home, screaming profanities at me for disputing the charge to my card and posting a negative review of his hotel on an Amsterdam travel website. I urge everyone... do NOT stay here under any circumstances. Dealing with this hotel and its owner ruined a good part of our trip and it was a decision I regret to this day. Simply awful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please please beware when you stay at this hotel. My husband's credit card was charged two weeks after we left the hotel. WE have tried to get our money back and the owner refuses to pay us back, We are now in contact with our bank who are sorting it out. The bank has said that there is a signature on the second slip which means someone forged my husband's signature!! Beware the worst it all is that the owner has dodged our calls and refuses to refund us this is fraud!! Stay away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service. Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: JuliaP_79
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Waterfront in good faith as they were the only hotel in Amsterdam who would accept a booking for 31st December by itself. My friend called up to confirm the reservation a week before, and was told that only 1 room had been reserved rather than two, and that we could not all stay in it due to fire regulations. We then made several complaints, and were eventually told to just 'turn up and we will look after you.' We then showed up on New Years eve (after a very long walk in the rain) and were told that we did not have any rooms at all. The owner first told us it was because of water damage, and five minutes later changed the excuse to say that placestostay had not told him we were coming. We knew this wasn't true as we had already been told over the phone that our names were in the diary, but for only 1 room. This was worrying, as he has obviously had to make excuses to many people that day if he can't remember which excuse is which. He eventually booked us onto what he described as a 'cruise boat' and I wish I had taken a picture of it, as it looked like a rickety old pirate ship. We did not even feel safe stepping on board, and the security was non-existent. You could just walk right onto the boat and inside without seeing anyone. In the end, we marched down to the Amsterdam Tourist board who found us a lovely hotel called the Lloyd, which I will also write a review for. By the way, the Waterfront's map is highly misleading. Look it up on multimap, it is not that central. It is a good 30 min walk from the centre. DO NOT DEAL WITH THIS MAN!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, comfortable rooms, clean. Very friendly people and very good breakfast. It is in the center of the town so everything is walking distance and, anyway, lots of tram stops are near the hotel. Me and my boyfriend had a very pleasant stay and recommend it always.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed four days at the Waterfront hotel. And it was a very satisfactory experience. The breakfast was a very nice buffet. My room was nice and very clean. The Staff was very friendly and always willing to help me with all my questions about the city. And what I like the most was that the hotel is very centraly located. One can easily walk to all the main atractions. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “The Waterfront Hotel Doesn't Care About its Guests!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given its splendid location and its pretty lobby and dining room, The Waterfront Hotel would seem to be a great place to base yourself while in Amsterdam. Alas, it's a poorly run, totally disorganized place that has a callous disregard for its guests. I stayed there for a week in 2001, and won't return. After confirming my reservation twice via email, I arrived after a long train ride from Paris to find that my room wasn't available. The staff made no effort to find me accomodations elsewhere and seemed disinterested when I showed them the email confirming my reservation. When I arrived the next day, after spending the night at a friend of a friend's house, (a desperate scramble that took many hours to arrange) I found that none of the rooms have telephones, despite the fact that the hotel's web site specifically stated otherwise. There is a payphone in the hallway, but that's it. I couldn't find another place to stay so I was stuck there. The rooms are cramped and overpriced and the canal rooms are noisy, with a disco next door generating crowds coming in and out until the very wee hours of the morning. What offended me most of all wasn't the mistake with my reservation, but the hotel's complete indifference to my plight. The hotel took messages from people calling for me only about half of the time. I will never stay there again and don't recommend it. Too bad, because its a gem of a location. However, there must be other places just as nice that actually care about their guests!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great location , friendly service , clean hotel,, good breakfast would happily return....

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 9 am the door was locked!! We had to wait until the shopkeeper next door arrived for her to call the owner and let him know we were there. We waited in the pouring rain for 45 minutes until the owner arrived. We then had to wait for our rooms. Unfortunately the canal rooms we reserved were not availble for three more days!!! We were placed in tiny cramped rooms with NO view what so ever. The rooms toilets when you flushed sprayed back all over you. To top all of this there was a nightclub right next door which was/is open until 5 AM!! Lastly the owner is dishonest. When we relocated elsewhere after staying here one horrendous night he told us we would not be charged for the rest of our reservation. He told us it would not be a problem to rent the rooms. We even checked back with him later on in the week to make sure he was able to rent the rooms or we would pay for 3 of the 8(cancellation policy) nights reserved. He assured us that he was able to rent them and there was no problem. Well, SURPRISE!! We received our credit card bill and he charged us for 8 nights!!! Stay clear of this hotel and this man!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed at the Waterfront during the withsun weekend and really enjoyed the place. Friendly and helpfull staff, the best location in town (near the flowermarket; all museums and tourist attractions at walking distance), clean and well equiped rooms, very complete breakfast! We'll certainly come back to this charming canal house and highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad security”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of spending a pre-paid week at this hotel in 2000. The hotel was locked when I first arrived so I had to wait outside (although they had my arrival schedule) for 1.5 hours until the owner returned. Less than 4 hours later, while I was having dinner, I returned to find that all of my belongs (2 credit cards, $1000 cash, CD Walkman, CD collection, driver's license, etc.) had been stolen by someone else in the hotel. The owner told me that he gave the hotel's master key to another guest because "he was cute and lost his room key". The hotel does not have any insurance for this loss nor were they willing to provide any compensation. I had to call internationally every week for 3 months before I finally received the police report from them. I STRONGLY recommend that others learn my misfortune and stay away from this place. I would also caution people that there is a VERY loud techno bar that shares a common wall with all the rooms on the right hand side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Congratulations on a well run comfortable and fully equipped hotel. We stayed at the Waterfront Hotel Amsterdam for 3 nights midweek (Wednesday 17th to Saturday 20th March 04) in a double room (Room No 2) which was en-suite complete with tea and coffee making facilities, hair dryer, fridge, central heated with cable TV, and I would like to especially mention the extremely comfortable bed with a thick duvet and comfy pillows. There was no view at all from our room but we went to Amsterdam to see Amsterdam and not sit in the hotel, we did notice through the once open door of room 3 that if you were lucky enough to get this room or any other rooms at the front you would be overlooking the Singel canal, that's why they call it the Waterfront Hotel I suppose. The hotel itself was very well equipped and you would not get better facilities or be made more welcome in a higher star hotel. The smallish breakfast room doubled as a lounge area again with free tea and coffee at any time of the day, this is where the manager also had a desk reception. The continental breakfast was first class with the usual ham & cheese, assorted bread, boiled eggs, fruit, bran cereal, toaster, etc. and you could help yourself to your hearts content. The breakfast and the comfy bed was worth the money on its own, not to mention the free post cards and card rack with all the places worth visiting situated in the Hotel entrance. The Waterfront was ideally situated for the areas that we wanted to go too, Leidsesplain and Renbrandtplein was only 5 minutes walk, also the flower market was literally down the street. If you want to go to Dam Square the Red Light District or the railway station then this is about a 10 to 15 minutes walk, the easy way was by tram which stops just around the corner from the Hotel were a number 1, 2 or 5 tram will take you to these places for 1.60 euros (single), cheaper if you buy a ticket in advance from the many outlets. Unfortunately during our stay, the outside of the hotel was being renovated and scaffolding covered the front of the building, but this shows that the owner is continually improving things and keeping the Hotel Waterfront to a high standard, these improvements did not effect us in any way and will be finished shortly. We were made very welcome by the Manager of the hotel who gave us a good deal for the 3 nights, and all in all our stay was extremely good and well worth me taking the time to write this as a thank you to the Manager for a his efforts in making our holiday break enjoyable. If you are visiting Amsterdam, be aware that the smaller hotels are not as easy to find in the good locations as you may imagine, so a visit to the Hotel Waterfront is highly recommend. Word of warning in and around Amsterdam, be aware of the many vagrants, drug dealers etc. that hang around mainly the Red Light district and the main drag in from the railway station (Damrak) if they approach you or bump into you just walk away as they may accuse you of banging into them and making them drop their drugs, which you will be asked to pay for in a polite way, well, polite for a drug dealer anyway. Regards Very satisfied customer from Preston England.

Reviews.Title: “it was a big deceit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went on Jan, 2004 and the only good things I can say about this hotel are that it was quiet at night, it's central location and the receptionist was nice.Apart from that, the hotel itself was very disapointing. For one thing, they were doing repairs on the faÃ§ade, I think they should have told us so when they confirmed the reservation but we never knew until we got there, so that the room didnÂ´t have a view on the canal, the building works wouldnÂ´t let us see a thing. As for the rest, it properly looked like a hostel: there was no reception desk nor anything like it, the recepcionist was sitting on the breakfast room which was also a resting area. The hotel has 3 floors, all corridors and stairs (no lift) are very narrow and smelt like humit. The breakfast room had also a funny smell. Our room was very small, there was literally room for the bed and the 2 night tables only, and they never came to clean nor change the towels. It was disapointing because the pictures they show on their websites had nothing to do with what it's like in reality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SophiagoestoItaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the small Waterfront Hotel in Amsterdam on the first and last nights of a recent European trip. Waterfront means it is on a canal, so the few rooms at the front would look out to it; we had a very small room on the third floor after hauling our suitcases up the steepest stairs I have ever seen (more like ladders!). The second time we stayed in Room 3, which is at the back, larger (though still very small) and quiet. This hotel is a short tram ride (routes 1,2 or 5) from the Central train station, a block from the flower market, and a short walk to the Leidesplein square. The Waterfront has a nice reception/breakfast room, with free coffee available all day, and the best breakfast buffet we had in Europe - lots of fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, breads, meat, eggs, cheeses - and attentive service by the owner/operator. Not cheap, but nothing in Amsterdam is; the Waterfront is a good, safe, clean base for exploring the city or in transit within Europe. One caution: we booked online through kasbah, and although we got a confirmation email from them, the hotel had not been informed! Luckily for us (after an 11-hour flight), there was a room available...but we learned to be careful about online bookings!

HotelInfo.Name: Amsterdam Waterfront Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Singel 458, Amsterdam 1017 AW , The Netherlands
